channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Assign device profiles in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to assign device configuration profiles and policies to users and devices. Learn how to exclude groups from a profile assignment in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows 10/11 devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Administrative templates in Microsoft Intune to create groups of settings for Windows 10/11 client devices. Use these settings in a device configuration profile. You can control Office programs, Microsoft Edge, access OneDrive, use remote desktop, enable Auto-Play, set power management settings, use HTTP printing, control user sign-in, and change the event log size.

item.title: Create device profiles in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or configure a device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Select the platform type, configure the settings, and add a scope tag. Learn more about applicability rules, and the policy refresh cycle times.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Government Service overview
item.description: Learn more about the Intune government service offerings and features. This article is designed to serve as an overview of the Microsoft Intune offering for government community cloud (GCC) High and United States Department of Defense (DoD) environments.

item.title: See device configuration policies with Microsoft Intune
item.description: See and manage the device configuration policy details in Microsoft Intune. Look at a graphical chart of the number of devices assigned to a policy, and see which devices have policies assigned or deployed. Can also troubleshoot policies that have conflict settings.

item.title: Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune
item.description: You can use Security Copilot to get information about your Intune data, including devices, apps, policies, and groups managed in Intune. You can also compare policies, get device specific details, and get target info for policies.

item.title: Network endpoints for US government deployments - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the list of US government endpoint URLs that Intune needs and requires. Allow the ports, IP addresses, and endpoint URLs in your proxy server configuration.

item.title: Microsoft Copilot in Intune features overview
item.description: Microsoft Copilot in Intune is an AI platform. It can help you create policies, get information about existing policies, and show more details on specific settings, including their impacts on users and devices. You can also use Copilot to troubleshoot device issues.

item.title: Explore Intune data with natural language and take action
item.description: In Microsoft Intune, use Explorer to query your data in natural language and run built-in queries that match your request. Copilot summarizes the results, and provides recommendations and actions based on the query results. You can also create policies that target users and groups in the query results. Use this feature to explore your Intune data, troubleshoot issues, and create custom reports.

item.title: Questions with policies and profiles in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Common questions, answers, and scenarios with device policies and profiles in Microsoft Intune. Learn more about profile changes not applying to users or devices, how long it takes for new policies to deploy, which settings apply when there are conflicts, what happens when you delete or remove a profile, and more.

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Security Copilot Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up and use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent for Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Security Copilot in Microsoft Surface Management Portal
item.description: You can use Security Copilot to help you manage and monitor Surface devices at scale.

item.title: Copilot in Intune shows device information and errors
item.description: Microsoft Copilot in Intune can help you get information about your devices, compare devices, and get error information. Use this information to help you manage and troubleshoot device issues.

item.title: Copilot in Intune FAQ
item.description: Get answers to common questions when using Copilot in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Remediations to detect and fix support issues
item.description: Learn more about Remediations in Microsoft Intune, including what Remediations are and view any prerequisites and licensing requirements. Also, learn how to deploy built-in and custom remediation scripts, and learn how to monitor your scripts.

item.title: Network endpoints for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review endpoints for Intune. This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for proxy settings in your Intune deployments.

item.title: Role-based access control (RBAC) with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how RBAC lets you control who can perform actions and make changes in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll Android, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, Linux, macOS, and Windows devices in Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Set up Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 1 for deploying or setting up Intune. The starting point is to review supported configurations, sign up for the trial, configure the custom domain name, add users and groups to Intune, assign licenses to users, manage roles, grant admin permissions, and set the MDM authority.

item.title: Install the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to install and configure the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Prerequisites for the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the software and network prerequisites for use of the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automatic enrollment in Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment of Windows 10/11 devices that join or register with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Add and assign an app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to add and assign an app.

item.title: Send notifications to noncompliant devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this topic, you use Microsoft Intune to send email notifications to noncompliant devices.

item.title: Evaluate and try - Enroll a device
item.description: In this evaluation task, enroll a device running Windows 10/11 into Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create a user in Intune
item.description: Create a user in Intune.

item.title: Create and assign an app protection policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you use Microsoft Intune to create and assign and app protection policy.

item.title: Create an email device profile for iOS/iPadOS devices
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune to create an email device profile so iOS/iPadOS devices can securely connect to company organization email.

item.title: Create and assign a custom role in Intune
item.description: Create and assign a custom role for a remote device manager.

item.title: Tutorial - Configure Slack to use Intune for EMM and app configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this tutorial you will configure Slack to use Intune for EMM and app configuration.

item.title: Create a group to manage users - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to create a group based on existing users.

item.title: Password compliance policy for Android Enterprise devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this topic, you will use Microsoft Intune to set the length of the password required for Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: Configure infrastructure to support SCEP certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune
item.description: To use Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) with Microsoft Intune, configure your on-premises AD domain, create a certification authority, and set up the NDES server to support use of the Certificate Connector.

item.title: Manually configure Jamf Pro integration with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Manually configure Jamf Pro integration with Intune when you can't use the Jamf Cloud Connector.

item.title: Set up BlackBerry Protect with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to set up the CylancePROTECT (BlackBerry) MTD solution with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Enable MDM automatic enrollment for Windows
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment for Windows devices joining or registering with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: ServiceNow integration with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: ServiceNow integration enables help desk staff, who are licensed to use Remote Help, to use ServiceNow to view incidents and details of the tech issue that an employee is facing from the Troubleshooting pane. This article also describes how to configure ServiceNow integration with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Unlicensed admins in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes how to give unlicensed admins permissions to access Intune.

item.title: Use multiple administrative approvals in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure multi-admin approval to protect your tenant against the use of compromised administrative accounts in Intune.

item.title: Use role-based access control (RBAC) and scope tags for distributed IT - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use role-based access control (RBAC) and scope tags to filter configuration profiles to specific roles.

item.title: Create a custom role in Intune
item.description: Learn how to create a custom role in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: About the Microsoft Intune tenant status page - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Intune tenant status page displays details about your tenant and the status of connectors you've configured, and messages intended for tenants and about the Intune service health.

item.title: Settings insight
item.description: The Settings insight feature adds insights giving you confidence in configurations that are successfully adopted by similar organizations.

item.title: Distributed IT with multiple admins
item.description: Learn about scaling guidelines for Microsoft Intune when you have a large number of local admins who need to manage their own users/devices and policies within the same tenant. Use Microsoft Intune's Role Based Access Control to manage access.

item.title: Sign up or sign in to Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to sign up for a Microsoft Intune subscription or sign in to start with your subscription.

item.title: Configure the Microsoft Managed Home Screen app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure the Microsoft Managed Home Screen app.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide for Windows device management
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Windows device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: A guide to managing iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide for Linux device management
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Linux device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Overview of Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Azure
item.description: Learn about the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Set up local admin account creation and password management for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up macOS account configuration with LAPS through automatic device enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Manage transferring data between iOS apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how to use mobile app management policies in Microsoft Intune to manage data transfers between apps.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: How to use Microsoft Entra ID to access Intune APIs in Microsoft Graph - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes steps needed for apps to use Microsoft Entra ID to access the Intune APIs in Microsoft Graph.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Get started with macOS endpoints - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune guide to set up and configure macOS devices from setup to creating policies and enrolling devices. You secure your corporate and organization-owned endpoints that are enrolled in Intune, and then deploy at scale with Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager.

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings for Microsoft Defender Antivirus for Intune
item.description: See a list of the settings in the Microsoft Defender Antivirus profile for Windows devices. You can configure these settings as part of Endpoint security Antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage volume-purchased iOS/iPadOS eBooks - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync books you purchased in volume from the iOS store with Intune. You can then manage and track usage.

item.title: Prerequisites the Microsoft Tunnel VPN for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the prerequisites for installation and use of the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. These include Linux servers, network, and firewall configurations.

item.title: Wrap iOS apps with the Intune App Wrapping Tool
item.description: Learn how to wrap your iOS apps without changing the code of the app itself. Prepare the apps so you can apply mobile app management policies.

item.title: Manage approved apps for Windows devices with App Control for Business policy and Managed Installers in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use App Control for Business policies and a managed installer to manage which apps are approved to run on Windows devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage Apple volume-purchased apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Configure Platform SSO for macOS devices
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Platform SSO for macOS devices. Platform SSO enables single sign-on (SSO) using a Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: App protection policies overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Microsoft Intune app protection policies help protect your company data and prevent data loss.

item.title: Connect Intune account to managed Google Play account - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to connect your Intune account to your Managed Google Play account.

item.title: App configuration policies for Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use app configuration policies on an iOS/iPadOS or Android device in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add, configure, and protect apps with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add, configure, and protect apps with Intune.

item.title: Data protection for Windows MAM
item.description: Enable protected MAM access to org data using Windows MAM.

item.title: Manage Microsoft 365 (Office) for iOS and Android with Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Microsoft 365 (Office) for iOS and Android to ensure collaboration experiences are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Microsoft Intune App SDK for iOS developer guide - Intune SDK integration into your iOS app
item.description: The Microsoft Intune App SDK for iOS lets you incorporate Intune app protection policies (also known as MAM policies) into your native iOS app. Intune SDK integration into your iOS app

item.title: Mobile Application Management (MAM) and Android Enterprise personally-owned work profiles in Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the available features when deciding to use Mobile Application Management (MAM) and/or Android Enterprise personally-owned work profiles for personal or BYOD Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune App SDK for iOS developer guide - Plan the integration
item.description: The Microsoft Intune App SDK for iOS lets you incorporate Intune app protection policies (also known as MAM policies) into your native iOS app. Plan the integration.

item.title: Add Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.description: This topic describes how to configure Intune app protection policy (APP) logs.

item.description: Get started with Intune before incorporating Intune mobile app management (MAM) into your Android app.

item.title: Microsoft Intune App SDK for Android developer integration and testing guide - MAM integration essentials
item.description: Understand MAM integration essentials to incorporate Intune mobile app management (MAM) into your Android app.

item.description: Learn how personal data is stored and processed in Intune.

item.description: The Microsoft Intune App SDK for iOS lets you incorporate Intune app protection policies (also known as MAM policies) into your native iOS app. MSAL prerequisite and setup

item.description: The Microsoft Intune App SDK for iOS lets you incorporate Intune app protection policies (also known as MAM policies) into your native iOS app. App participation features

item.description: Understand the MSAL prerequisite to incorporate Intune mobile app management (MAM) into your Android app.

item.description: This article describes the app protection policy (APP) settings for MAM on Windows.

item.title: How to wipe only corporate data from apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to selectively wipe only corporate data from Intune-managed apps with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage Teams for iOS and Android with Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Teams for iOS and Android to ensure team collaboration experiences are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Manage Microsoft Edge on iOS and Android with Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Edge for iOS and Android to ensure corporate websites are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.description: Learn about personal data collected in Intune.
